replies.msg:
è‹±æ–‡ç‰ˆ

To The Consulate General of ____

Dear consul of _____,

I’m a Hong Kong citizen writing to urge the Consulate General of ______ to update your travel advisory for Hong Kong. In the light of the recent events of violent suppression by the Hong Kong Police Force (HKPF) towards protesters and citizens, along with the police being incompetent to prevent the stochastic attack of triad members on innocent civilians in Yuen Long MTR station on July 21st, it is observed that public safety in Hong Kong is under tremendous threat. I believe that the HKPF has lost its legitimacy to protect its own citizens, let alone tourists. As more protests and clashes are likely to happen all over Hong Kong, there is a likelihood that such clashes could involve significant violence, with the possibility of casualties amongst those involved in clashes or accidentally caught up in events. Tourists are vulnerable in such uncertain conditions.

In recent weeks several large-scale demonstrations have taken place in Hong Kong. Not only did the government refuse to directly respond to the demand of protesters, the HKPF repeatedly used excessive and unnecessary force to disperse protesters and citizens. For example, on July 14th, riot police entered New Town Plaza, a shopping mall located in Shatin, at about 10pm to disperse protesters. Pepper spray and batons were used on protesters, bystanders and tourists. On July 21st, the HKPF allegedly fired more than 30 shots of bean bag bullets towards anyone in Sheung Wan and Sai Wan without warning. Police incompetence and brutality were also validated by Amnesty International, which has reported that the HKPF had failed to maintain law and order while acting in accordance to the law.

On July 21st, alleged local triad members gathered in Yuen Long MTR station and used weapons, including metal rods and bamboo sticks, to attack and gangbang passersby indiscriminately. They first threatened and terrorised citizens in the station. Then, they rushed to platforms and into train compartments to attack the innocent, including citizens, reporters and lawmakers. The HKPF failed to arrive at the scene in a timely manner to prevent the bloodshed. Many were injured and sent to hospital, including a pregnant woman who appeared unconscious. During this time, the emergency services number 999 and report rooms in nearby police stations were temporarily out of service. If tourists encounter such incidents in the future, there is no guarantee that they would receive a timely response when they reach out for help.


Furthermore, large scale protests and demonstrations are likely to continue in the future. Such protests and demonstrations are likely to impact tourists severely with major roads closed and public transportation interfered.

“One country, two systems” is the basis of governance in Hong Kong. Recent events have shown that such basis is undermined by the Chinese Government using excessive violence. The violent behaviour of the HKPF and the political state of Hong Kong render an unsafe environment for tourists from all countries. Therefore, I hereby strongly urge the Consulate general of ________ and the ______ government to update the travel advisory of Hong Kong to ensure the safety of your citizens.


Regards,
Xxx
Hong Kong Citizen

To The Consulate General of _______

Dear consuls, 

I’m a Hong Kong citizen writing to urge the Consulate General __________ to advise AGAINST all travel to Hong Kong. Public safety in Hong Kong is undoubtedly under tremendous threats at this very moment, given the recent violent suppression by the Hong Kong Police Force (HKPF) on protesters and citizens, as well as the incompetence of the HKPF to protect innocent civilians from stochastic attacks by local triads in Yuen Long MTR station on July 21st. I believe that the HKPF has lost its legitimacy and capability to protect its own citizens, let alone tourists. There is a high possibility that the current political issues in Hong Kong will threaten the lives of innocent tourists from the ___. In order to minimise damages and casualties, I urge all ____ citizens to stop travelling to Hong Kong.

In recent weeks, several large-scale rallies have taken place in Hong Kong. Not only did the Hong Kong Government refused to directly respond to the demands of the protesters, but also encouraged the excessive and unnecessary violence used by the HKPF on citizens. For example, at night on July 14th, riot police entered a shopping mall in Sha Tin to disperse protesters. Victims of pepper sprays and police batons were not restricted to protesters, but also bystanders and tourists. Also, on July 21st in Central and Western District, the HKPF fired over 30 shots of bean bag bullets without warning at protesters staying put. Such incompetence and brutality of the HKPF is already recognised by the Amnesty International with reports showcasing how the HKPF has been exercising these violence acts against regulations. However, the HKPF shows no remorse and continues to rule Hong Kong with brutal force.

At the same time on July 21st in Yuen Long District, local triads gathered at Yuen Long MTR station and indiscriminately attacked innocent citizens with weapons including metal rods and bamboo sticks. They first surrounded the station and terrorised citizens within. All of a sudden, they stormed into train platforms and even inside the trains to physically assault innocent citizens, reporters and even lawmakers. It is ridiculous and unacceptable that the HKPF took over 90 minutes to send armed squads to the spot when the nearest police station was only 1 km away. In addition, there are footages showing that two police constables were once at the station, but they turned a blind eye on the triads and left the station, leaving citizens endangered. After the attack, many were injured and sent to hospital, including a pregnant woman who appeared unconscious. Rumours are now spreading that abortion had been performed to that pregnant woman. During the entire incident, the emergency telephone number 999 and report rooms in nearby police stations were temporarily out of service. If such incidents happen to tourists from the ___ in the future, their safety will be seriously jeopardised as there is no guarantee of a timely response from the HKPF.

Furthermore, large scale protests and demonstrations are likely to continue in the future, as the HK government has been unbelievably ignorant of the demands by its people. Such protests and demonstrations are likely to impact tourists severely with major roads closed and public transportation interfered. And most importantly during these rallies, the excessive violence employed by the HKPF poses a great threat to the safety of tourists from the ___.

“One country, two systems” is the basis of governance in Hong Kong. However, recent events have shown that such basis is being acutely undermined by the Hong Kong Government as a marionette of the Chinese Communist Party. The inappropriately violent behaviour of the HKPF and the unstable political state of Hong Kong have rendered Hong Kong a dangerous destination for tourists from any country. I hereby strongly urge the Consulate General _________ and the _____ Government to advise AGAINST all travel to Hong Kong.

Regards,
______
Hong Kong Citizen

my english draft, æœ‰ video link reference. è«‹éš¨æ„ç”¨

To The Consulate General of ____

I’m a writing with a heavy heart to urge the _______ to update the travel advisory for Hong Kong. In light of the recent events of violent suppression by the Hong Kong Police Force (HKPF) towards protesters and citizens, along with the police deliberately harbouring triad members’ stochastic attacks on innocent civilians in Yuen Long MTR station on July 21st, it is apparent that public safety in Hong Kong is under tremendous threat. I believe that the HKPF has lost its legitimacy to protect its own citizens, let alone tourists. As more protests and clashes are likely to occur within the near future, there is a likelihood that such clashes could involve significant violence, with the possibility of casualties amongst those involved in clashes or accidentally caught up in events. Tourists are vulnerable in such uncertain conditions.

In recent weeks several large-scale demonstrations have taken place in Hong Kong. Not only did the government refuse to directly respond to the demand of protesters, the HKPF repeatedly used excessive and unjustified force to disperse protesters, citizens and journalist, both local and foreign. For example, on July 14th, riot police entered New Town Plaza, a shopping mall located in Shatin, at about 10pm to disperse protesters. Pepper spray and batons were used on protesters and bystanders. On July 21st, the HKPF allegedly fired more than 30 shots of bean bag bullets towards the crowd in Sheung Wan and Sai Wan without prior warning. Police incompetence and brutality were also validated by Amnesty International [1], which has reported that the HKPF had failed to maintain law and order while acting in accordance to the law.

On July 21st, alleged local triad members gathered in Yuen Long MTR station and used weapons, including metal rods and bamboo sticks, to indiscriminately attack protestors, journalists and innocent onlookers. They first threatened and terrorised citizens in the station. Then, they rushed to platforms and into train carriages to attack the innocent, including citizens, reporters and lawmakers. Video recordings from the day [2] has depicted the chaos and violence on scene. At 1:40 of the video, an alleged triad member, in pale clothing, were seen chasing down and beating a journalist, who was wearing a yellow high-vis vest with “PRESS” labelled clearly. Meanwhile in the background a mob of the same triad in white shirts were surrounding and beating a pregnant woman.

The HKPF has failed to arrive at the scene in a timely manner to prevent the bloodshed. Many were injured and sent to hospital, including the pregnant woman who appeared unconscious. During this time, the emergency services number 999 and report rooms in nearby police stations were temporarily out of service. If tourists encounter such incidents in the future, there is no guarantee that they would receive a timely response when they reach out for help.

During the July 21st protest in Yuen Long, evidence of the police harbouring alleged triad members were captured by journalists from RTHK [3]. In the video, the police superintendent told reporters that officers on scene did not see anyone in possession of weaponry and therefore did not perform any arrest. However, journalists have video evidence of the police officers mingling and giving directions to alleged triad members (in white shirts), some of them clearly armed with long metallic objects that resemble steel pipes.

“One country, two systems” is the basis of governance in Hong Kong. However, recent events have shown that such basis is undermined by the Chinese Government using excessive violence. The violent behaviour of the HKPF and the political state of Hong Kong render an unsafe environment for tourists from all countries. Therefore, I hereby strongly urge the ________ of ________ and the ______ government to update the travel advisory of Hong Kong to ensure the safety of your citizens.

Yours sincerely,
Xxx

[1] https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2019/06/hong-kong-police-violence-verified/

[2] https://www.facebook.com/tsetk/videos/10157546384988833/

[3] https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=2297471770308698
